intro: Knautia velutina, commonly known as the velvet knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flower heads. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves that give it a soft, velvety appearance. It typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats and thrives in full sun. Knautia velutina is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant blooms and sturdy growth habit.
